senses.de: A natural feeling or behavior, doing without thinking

Tips.title: Unconscious Action
Tips.description: An instinct doesn't require conscious thought; it happens automatically.
Tips.example: He ducked out of instinct when the ball flew at his head.

Tips.title: Immediate Response
Tips.description: Instinct is often your immediate reaction before you've had time to think.
Tips.example: By instinct, she immediately reached out to catch the falling vase.

Tips.title: Inherent Skill
Tips.description: Some behaviors, like a spider spinning a web, are instinctual and don't need to be learned.
Tips.example: Without teaching, the puppies knew by instinct how to play and chase.

senses.de: A way of behaving or thinking that is part of a person's nature
senses.ex: His first instinct was to run.

Tips.title: Natural Tendency
Tips.description: Instinct refers to behaviors that feel natural or are innate, not acquired.
Tips.example: Her instinct to nurture was clear when she immediately soothed the crying child.

Tips.title: Not Always Correct
Tips.description: An instinctual reaction isn't always the right choice; sometimes it's better to reevaluate.
Tips.example: His first instinct was to lash out, but upon reflection, he chose to remain calm.

senses.ex: She was instinct with a sense of danger.

Tips.title: Rare Usage
Tips.description: The adjective form 'instinct' is not commonly used and might feel old-fashioned.
Tips.example: The whole room was instinct with an air of mystery.

Tips.title: Emotional Charge
Tips.description: When used as an adjective, 'instinct' suggests being filled with a strong emotion or quality.
Tips.example: Their voices were instinct with joy as they sang the celebratory song.

Intuition.wordDefinition:
Instinct and intuition are closely related but have subtle differences.

Intuition refers to a gut feeling or inner sense that something is true or should be done.

Intuition can be applied in various contexts, such as making personal or professional decisions, while instinct is more applicable in survival situations or actions that are innate and automatic.

quotes.Text: There can be no doubt that the average man blames much more than he praises. His instinct is to blame. If he is satisfied he says nothing; if he is not, he most illogically kicks up a row.
quotes.Title: Israeli Leader
quotes.Name: Golda Meir

quotes.Text: I always tell actors when they go in for an audition: Don't be afraid to do what your instincts tell you. You may not get the part, but people will take notice.
quotes.Title: Actor
quotes.Name: Robert De Niro

quotes.Text: That's the difference between a great comic and a bad comic - one has great instincts and has a lot of compassion and can feel what's right and what's wrong.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Ali Wong

quotes.Text: She had a womanly instinct that clothes possess an influence more powerful over many than the worth of character or the magic of manners.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Louisa May Alcott

quotes.Text: I think that instinct, that storytelling instinct, rescued me most of my life.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Armistead Maupin

quotes.Text: Passion for fame: A passion which is the instinct of all great souls.
quotes.Title: Irish Statesman
quotes.Name: Edmund Burke

quotes.Text: I really just followed my musical instincts every step of my life.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Boz Scaggs

quotes.Text: Everything that I've ever made in my life is from my instinct.
quotes.Title: Russian Director
quotes.Name: Genndy Tartakovsky

quotes.Text: Happens I am very political. I have deep political instincts.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: Will Ferrell

quotes.Text: I've always kind of done exactly what my instincts said.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Sienna Miller
